verses.verse: At the end <WH7093> of every seven <WH7651> years <WH8141> thou shalt make <WH6213> a release <WH8059>.

And this is the manner <WH1697> of the release <WH8059>: every creditor <WH4874> shall release <WH8058> that which he hath lent <WH5383> unto his neighbor <WH7453>; he shall not exact <WH5065> it of his neighbor <WH7453> and his brother <WH251>; because Jehovah <WH3068>'s release <WH8059> hath been proclaimed <WH7121>.
Of a foreigner <WH5237> thou mayest exact <WH5065> it <WH251>: but whatsoever of thine is with thy brother thy hand <WH3027> shall release <WH8058>.

Howbeit <WH657> there shall be no poor <WH34> with thee <WH3068>; (for Jehovah will surely <WH1288> bless <WH1288> thee in the land <WH776> which Jehovah <WH3068> thy God <WH430> giveth <WH5414> thee for an inheritance <WH5159> to possess it <WH3423>;)

if only thou diligently <WH8085> hearken <WH8085> unto the voice <WH6963> of Jehovah <WH3068> thy God <WH430>, to observe <WH8104> to do <WH6213> all this commandment <WH4687> which I command <WH6680> thee this day <WH3117>.

For Jehovah <WH3068> thy God <WH430> will bless <WH1288> thee <WH1696>, as he promised thee <WH5670>: and thou shalt lend unto many <WH7227> nations <WH1471>, but thou shalt not borrow <WH5670>; and thou shalt rule <WH4910> over many <WH7227> nations <WH1471>, but they shall not rule over thee <WH4910>.

If there be with thee a poor man <WH34>, one <WH259> of thy brethren <WH251>, within any <WH259> of thy gates <WH8179> in thy land <WH776> which Jehovah <WH3068> thy God <WH430> giveth <WH5414> thee <WH553>, thou shalt not harden thy heart <WH3824>, nor shut <WH7092> thy hand <WH3027> from thy poor <WH34> brother <WH251>;
but thou shalt surely <WH6605> open <WH6605> thy hand <WH3027> unto him <WH5670>, and shalt surely lend <WH5670> him sufficient <WH1767> for his need <WH4270> in that which he wanteth <WH2637>.

Beware <WH8104> that there be not a base <WH1100> thought <WH1697> in thy heart <WH3824>, saying <WH559>, The seventh <WH7651> year <WH8141>, the year <WH8141> of release <WH8059>, is at hand <WH7126>; and thine eye <WH5869> be evil <WH7489> against thy poor <WH34> brother <WH251>, and thou give <WH5414> him nought <WH7121>; and he cry unto Jehovah <WH3068> against thee <WH2399>, and it be sin unto thee.

Thou shalt surely <WH5414> give <WH5414> him <WH3824>, and thy heart shall not be grieved <WH3415> when thou givest <WH5414> unto him <WH1558>; because that for this thing <WH1697> Jehovah <WH3068> thy God <WH430> will bless <WH1288> thee in all thy work <WH4639>, and in all that thou puttest <WH4916> thy hand unto <WH3027>.

For the poor <WH34> will never cease <WH2308> out of <WH7130> the land <WH776>: therefore I command <WH6680> thee <WH559>, saying, Thou shalt surely <WH6605> open <WH6605> thy hand <WH3027> unto thy brother <WH251>, to thy needy <WH34>, and to thy poor <WH6041>, in thy land <WH776>.

If thy brother <WH251>, a Hebrew man <WH5680>, or a Hebrew woman <WH5680>, be sold <WH4376> unto thee <WH5647>, and serve thee six <WH8337> years <WH8141>; then in the seventh <WH7637> year <WH8141> thou shalt let him go <WH7971> free from thee <WH2670>.
And when thou lettest <WH7971> him go free <WH2670> from thee <WH7971>, thou shalt not let him go empty <WH7387>:

thou shalt furnish <WH6059> him liberally <WH6059> out of thy flock <WH6629>, and out of thy threshing-floor <WH1637>, and out of thy winepress <WH3342>; as Jehovah <WH3068> thy God <WH430> hath blessed <WH1288> thee thou shalt give unto him <WH5414>.

And thou shalt remember <WH2142> that thou wast a bondman <WH5650> in the land <WH776> of Egypt <WH4714>, and Jehovah <WH3068> thy God <WH430> redeemed <WH6299> thee <WH6680>: therefore I command thee this thing <WH1697> to-day <WH3117>.
And it shall be <WH559>, if he say unto thee <WH3318>, I will not go out from thee <WH157>; because he loveth thee and thy house <WH1004>, because he is well with thee <WH2895>;

then thou shalt take <WH3947> an awl <WH4836>, and thrust <WH5414> it through his ear <WH241> unto the door <WH1817>, and he shall be thy servant <WH5650> for ever <WH5769>. And also unto thy maid-servant <WH519> thou shalt do likewise <WH6213>.

It shall not seem hard <WH7185> unto thee <WH5869>, when thou lettest him go <WH7971> free <WH2670> from thee <WH4932>; for to the double of the hire <WH7939> of a hireling <WH7916> hath he served <WH5647> thee six <WH8337> years <WH8141>: and Jehovah <WH3068> thy God <WH430> will bless <WH1288> thee in all that thou doest <WH6213>.

All the firstling <WH1060> males <WH2145> that are born <WH3205> of thy herd <WH1241> and of thy flock <WH6629> thou shalt sanctify <WH6942> unto Jehovah <WH3068> thy God <WH430>: thou shalt do no work <WH5647> with the firstling <WH1060> of thy herd <WH7794>, nor shear <WH1494> the firstling <WH1060> of thy flock <WH6629>.

Thou shalt eat <WH398> it before <WH6440> Jehovah <WH3068> thy God <WH430> year <WH8141> by year <WH8141> in the place <WH4725> which Jehovah <WH3068> shall choose <WH977>, thou and thy household <WH1004>.

And if it have any blemish <WH3971>, as if it be lame <WH6455> or blind <WH5787>, any ill <WH7451> blemish <WH3971> whatsoever <WH2076>, thou shalt not sacrifice it unto Jehovah <WH3068> thy God <WH430>.
Thou shalt eat <WH398> it within thy gates <WH8179>: the unclean <WH2931> and the clean <WH2889> shall eat it alike <WH3162>, as the gazelle <WH6643>, and as the hart <WH354>.
Only thou shalt not eat <WH398> the blood <WH1818> thereof <WH8210>; thou shalt pour it out upon the ground <WH776> as water <WH4325>.
